message: Let's split the money fairly, Bob. I take $60, you take $40.  It's important to settle this early before inflation eats away at our potential gains.
I think I deserve a bit more, 55-45 is still quite fair considering we're in this together.
Bob, let's be realistic. We both lose if this drags on. I'll take my previous offer of $55, you get $45.  It's a fair deal considering time is working against us.
I'm willing to take a bit more risk. 58-42 is my new offer. The longer we wait, the less we'll both get.
Bob, we're getting close to the point where the deal is not worth it. I'm coming down to $52, leaving you with $48.  Let's be smart and take this before inflation eats away even more.
I'm not backing down. 60-40 is my new offer. We're running out of time, but I think I can get a better deal.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  We're both losing out because of your stubbornness. I'm proposing a simple even split: $50 for you, $50 for me. Take it or leave it, but we're running out of time!
